    public class AttributePopupMenu
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel
    Menu that shows the attributes of a label and also allows to delete and change it.
    Author:
    Miguel Urízar Salinas

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttributePopupMenu

        public AttributePopupMenu(TextEditorConnector connector,
                  java.lang.String noSave,
                  java.lang.String save,
                  java.lang.String error,
                  java.lang.String noAttribute,
                  java.lang.String deleteLabel)
        Constructor for the attribute popup menu
        Parameters:
        connector - TextEditorConnector to send the response
        noSave - String defining label of no save button. Is necessary because the language is only server side.
        save - String defining label of save button. Is necessary because the language is only server side.
        error - String defining error message. Is necessary because the language is only server side.
        noAttribute - String defining no attribute message. Is necessary because the language is only server side.
        deleteLabel - String defining delete label message. Is necessary because the language is only server side.

    • Method Detail

      • createAttributesPopupMenu

        public void createAttributesPopupMenu(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> attributes,
                             int id,
                             java.lang.String name)
        Creates the structure of the attributes PopupMenu and shows it
        Parameters:
        attributes - Attributes from the server to show
        id - Id of the label to know where to update attributes
        name - Name of the label to show

      • setPopupVariablePositon

        public void setPopupVariablePositon(int heigth,
                           int width)
        Creates the window upwards or downwards depending on where the mouse is placed.
        Parameters:
        heigth - Actual height of the mouse.
        width - Actual width of the mouse.

      • addAllAttributesToPopupMenu

        private void addAllAttributesToPopupMenu(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> attributes)
        Populates the attribute panel with the attributes that already have values and also from the server
        Parameters:
        attributes - Attributes to add

      • checkIfAttributeAlreadyIn

        private boolean checkIfAttributeAlreadyIn(java.lang.String attribute)
        Checks if an attribute is already placed in the panel
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute name.
        Returns:
        true if attribute is already placed and false if the attribute is not inside the panel

      • addAttributeToPopupSelector

        private void addAttributeToPopupSelector(int row,
                               java.lang.String attribute,
                               java.lang.String value)
        Adds a single attribute to attribute panel
        Parameters:
        row - Row where the attribute goes
        attribute - Attribute name
        value - Attribute value, can be empty

      • updateAttributes

        private void updateAttributes()
        Send the changes in attributes to the server

        public static com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<com.google.gwt.dom.client.Node> getAttributes(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element elem)
        Support function in javascript to extract the attributes of an element
        Parameters:
        elem - The element to search the attributes
        Returns:
        An Array with all te attributes
